# Tutorial Onboarding Checkpoints

This document helps users and contributors self-assess progress through the tutorial system.

---

## Fundamentals Checkpoint

You should be able to:
- Explain what a document represents
- Describe the role of URIs and collections
- Trace an end-to-end request conceptually

---

## Querying Checkpoint

You should be able to:
- Choose between URI fetch, search, and Optic
- Explain Optic rows and joins
- Predict when indexes are required

---

## Rails Integration Checkpoint

You should be able to:
- Map models to documents intentionally
- Encapsulate queries in query objects
- Avoid ActiveRecord-style assumptions

---

## Operations Checkpoint

You should be able to:
- Explain how queries and indexes evolve together
- Reason about performance issues
- Coordinate change safely

If any checkpoint feels unclear, revisit the corresponding domain.
